lv.emes.libraries.utilities

Class MS_ProbabilityEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.utilities.MS_ProbabilityEvent

  • public class MS_ProbabilityEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    Sometimes we need to test, if some event with defined probability happens. This is easy way to define events and handle their happening with some probability. -happened -changeProbability
    Version:
    1.1.
    Author:
    eMeS
    See Also:
    MSProbabilityEventExample

      Creates event with defined probability to happen.

    • Method Detail

      • happened

        public boolean happened()
        Tests, if event happened and increase current progress so next time there will be greater chance for event to happen.
        Returns:
        true if event happened, false, if not.

      • changeProbability

        public void changeProbability(int newProbabilityPercent)
        Sometimes probability of event happening may change due to other condition changes.
        Parameters:
        newProbabilityPercent - 0..100, if violated then maximum or minimum regarding of to which side.

      • changeProbability

        public void changeProbability(float probability)
        Sometimes probability of event happening may change due to other condition changes.
        Parameters:
        probability - 0.0..1.0, if violated then maximum or minimum regarding of to which side.

      • getProbabilityAsPercent

        public int getProbabilityAsPercent()
        Returns:
        probability of event to happen with precision of 2 decimals.

      • getCurrentProgressAsPercent

        public int getCurrentProgressAsPercent()
        Returns:
        percentage of event made so far rounded to precision of 2 decimals.

      • getProbability

        public float getProbability()
        Returns:
        probability of event to happen with precision of 2 decimals.

      • getCurrentProgress

        public float getCurrentProgress()
        Returns:
        event made so far absolute value (0..1).
